result.execSummary:
The defendant Shewonnia L Scott was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Battery [Modifiers: Domestic Abuse - Infliction of Physical Pain or Injury], a class A misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 940.19(1).
  • Bail Jumping-Misdemeanor, a class A misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 946.49(1)(a).

Charge(s) in this case were read in to this or other case(s). A "read in" charge is a charge that is dismissed as part of a plea agreement, however:

  • The defendant agrees to have the court consider the charge(s) when sentencing for another crime, under Wis. Stats. 973.20(1g)(b); and
  • The defendant cannot be prosecuted for these charge(s) in the future.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

parties.name: Waukesha County Clerk of Circuit Court

supervisions.notes: Straight Time. Sentence credit of 15 days were granted if imposed.

miscConds.notes: Costs to be paid as a condition of probation.

Submit to an AODA assessment, follow through with any treatment, counseling.  No use or possession of alcohol or illegal drugs/drug paraphernalia. Comply with random urine screens.  Maintain absolute sobriety. No use or possession of prescription drugs without a valid prescription. Valid prescriptions only with prior agent approval and to be taken only in the manner they are ordered.
**FIRST 60 DAYS of probation to be with SCRAM Monitoring.
**11/12/2015 COURT GRANTS REQUEST FROM DOC FOR DEFENDANT TO BE MONITORED BY THE SOBERLINK DEVICE INSTEAD OF SCRAM.**

Domestic Violence Counseling through a State Certified Batterers Intervention Program such as Alliance Counseling or Family Services of Waukesha and Anger Management and follow through as recommeded by agent.

No Violent Contact with the victim. Maintain employment and/or school combination. Follow through with any treatment or counseling recommended by agent. 
  If probation is revoked and a prison term is not ordered, or if probation is discharged/terminated, a civil judgment shall be entered against the defendant and in favor of restitution victims and government entities for outstanding financial obligations.  Collection may include income assignment.

result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Shewonnia L Scott

records.descr: Records of prosec. are converted data. See file.

records.addlTxt: Order revoking huber privileges.   Signed by Judge Carter on 11/10/16.
Dated 11/08/16, from Jail Adminstration requestion that the Court formally revoke defendant's Huber privileges.
Return of Notice of Entry of Judgment addressed to the Defendant.
Wis. Dept. of Corrections notice of case status change received.  Outstanding financial obligations have been converted to a civil judgment.
Notice of Case Status Change - Revoked - Sentenced to Jail/HOC
(Orig.) ... for amendment to the Judgment of Conviction, dated 10/29/15, filed by Agent Jumbeck.
with Elements of criminal offenses to which plea is being entered.

Defendant Shewonnia L Scott in court, in custody, with Attorney Kelsey Morin.   Brian J. Juech appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Defendant enters a guilty plea to Counts #1 & 2.  Court performs plea colloquy and finds Defendant guilty of Counts #1 & 2.  Count #3 is dismissed and read-in.  Read-in list charges are also dismissed and read-in.  State gives sentencing recommendations.  Attorney Morin makes statements regarding sentencing.  Defendant makes statements.  Court sentences the Defendant to the following:

COUNT #1:  IMPOSED AND STAYED SENTENCE OF:   

5 MONTHS STRAIGHT TIME  (CREDIT - 15 days)   *CONSECUTIVE TO COUNT #2*

TERM OF PROBATION:  18 MONTHS    *CONCURRENT WITH COUNT #2 AND CASE #15CM706 AND CASE #15CM1385

CONDITIONS OF PROBATON:  
____AODA Assessment and follow through with any treatment recommended;
____Absolute Sobriety;  Random U.A.'s ; 
____No Use or Possession of alcohol or illegal drugs/drug paraphernalia  
____No Use or Possession of prescription drugs without a valid prescription;
____Any valid prescription drugs must be taken only in the manner in which they are 
prescribed/sign releases.
____Follow through with any treatment and/or counseling recommended by Agent;
____Maintain employment and/or combination of schooling 
____No violent contact with: victim
____Domestic Violence Counseling through a State Certified Batterers Intervention Program such as Alliance Counseling or Family Services of Waukesha and Anger Management and follow through as recommended by agent 
____1st 60 Days of probation to be with SCRAM monitoring 

COSTS:  $343.00 & $200.00 DNA surcharge (to be paid as a condition of probation)


COUNT #2:  IMPOSED AND STAYED SENTENCE OF:   

5 MONTHS STRAIGHT TIME     *CONSECUTIVE TO COUNT #1*

TERM OF PROBATION:  18 MONTHS    *CONCURRENT WITH COUNT #1 AND CASE #15CM706 AND CASE #15CM1385

CONDITIONS OF PROBATON:  
____AODA Assessment and follow through with any treatment recommended;
____Absolute Sobriety;  Random U.A.'s ; 
____No Use or Possession of alcohol or illegal drugs/drug paraphernalia  
____No Use or Possession of prescription drugs without a valid prescription;
____Any valid prescription drugs must be taken only in the manner in which they are 
prescribed/sign releases.
____Follow through with any treatment and/or counseling recommended by Agent;
____Maintain employment and/or combination of schooling 
____No violent contact with: victim
____Domestic Violence Counseling through a State Certified Batterers Intervention Program such as Alliance Counseling or Family Services of Waukesha and Anger Management and follow through as recommended by agent
____1st 60 days of probation to be with SCRAM monitoring 

COSTS:  $243.00 (to be paid as a condition of probation)

Defendant to comply with I.D. Processing.    Absolute sobriety, defendant is not to possess or consume any alcohol.  Defendant is not to have any violent contact with witness listed in the criminal complaint.    Defendant is not to use/possess any controlled substances without a valid prescription and take as prescribed.

Defendant Shewonnia L Scott in court, in custody, with attorney Sam Benedict for attorney Kelsey Morin.   Pablo Galaviz appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  NOT GUILTY PLEA ENTERED BY COURT.
  Hearing scheduled for September 17, 2015 at 03:30 pm.
Waukesha County Pretrial Screening Services Report by Wisconsin Community Services filed.
